prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape description Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. Creating a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Drawing the base 2D sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. 2. Draw the rectangle shape by creating four lines with these points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.7484, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.7484, 0.0] to [0.7484, 0.75] - Line 3: [0.7484, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] Drawing the top 2D sketch 1. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system and use the same coordinate system origin. 2. Draw the triangle shape by creating three lines with these points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.7484, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.7484, 0.0] to [0.3742, 0.375] - Line 3: [0.3742, 0.375] to [0.0, 0.0] Scaling the 2D sketches Scale both sketches by a factor of 0.75. Transforming 2D sketches to 3D sketches Transform the 2D sketches to 3D sketches by applying the same Euler angles and translation vector as the coordinate system in part 1. Extruding the sketches to create the final shape 1. Extrude the base sketch by 0.1875 along the positive Z-axis of the coordinate system. 2. Extrude the top sketch by 0.1875 along the negative Z-axis of the coordinate system. 3. Define the boolean operation as 'join' to combine the base and top parts. Storing shape details Store the shape details as follows: - Shape: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line. - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.1875</description>
